title: Grade 7
subject: English Language Arts - Extended Learning Standards (2019-)

document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards – Extended with Learning Progressions English Language Arts

24F5D7E1E1A54B9D8875D611AD7C5E6C.description: Engage with grade-level peers, and adults to gain ageappropriate word exposure.

1D36823D68884ACCAD75B764E656C049.description:
Match grade-level subject specific words to their meanings
using any form, including images or objects.

47132BE5B4514FFA9ED8A3D91ABCB674.description:
Choose appropriate domain-specific words for writing or
speaking.

C565DE4E6F2D44BDB91E9A8662EDD5A4.description:
Communicate
using grade-level
words and phrases
acquired through
interactions with
others.

FFB402EB61B74DBDA68CDD380983BD34.description:

and domainspecific words by
connecting them to an
appropriate subject or
topic.

grade-level,
age-appropriate
academic and
content-specific
words and phrases
in speaking and
writing.

9BE78574D8A94EDAB183F93F64D65505.description:
Acquire and use
accurately grade-appropriate
general academic and
domain-specific words and
phrases; gather vocabulary
knowledge when considering
a word or phrase important to
comprehension or expression.

4F0BAC79263B4FE3AEA86E6253C177A6.description:

7E3502AE67294CCDADB80AC345017C39.description:

15DE03C4DFE843399B7C442B1A016500.description: Identify words with conceptual differences (e.g., hot/cold).

5F1DD6EBC1804F00AD919BF7A2DD8C9E.description: Identify when a word or phrase is being used in a nonliteral way.

56CF975071C34618B778DD6AC61A8274.description: Match connotations to their denotative word.

8BEE60D78E50471CA35E984799F0E534.description:

and antonyms.

A3DAF8C376384DEE8F4F22E315EE8A91.description:

(alternate meanings based on feelings associated with a
word).

455D0751886149FA9039554151B35825.description:
Identify
connections
between words
and their uses.

CDD52B5FFF0043169BCB1B923B5A950B.description:
Identify
the relationship
between words such
as synonyms and
antonyms and simple
connotations.

0527E4E435A34DBCB4527535D73C0D01.description:

the meaning of
figurative language
(e.g., similes,
metaphors)

D6A4FE1DC4304F199A9412D5210209C5.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of figurative
language, word relationships,
and nuances in word
meanings.
a. Interpret figures of speech

mythological allusions) in
context.
b. Use the relationship
between particular
words (e.g., synonym/
antonym, analogy) to better
understand each of the
words.
c. Distinguish among the
connotations (associations)
of words with similar
denotations (definitions)
(e.g., refined, respectful,
polite, diplomatic,
condescending).

29EEACA32DBE464290DB624356503394.description:

5A57050D59274173946FB90DCA3B75BC.description:

0755829EE5694DDDAF27E5570E5DBEEB.description:

6C307B41117A463FBF2EEA4247DF9B90.description:

86A087CF9A194E18AACA3DA61E9F0975.description:
identify the meaning of a word based on sentence or

533C1D3CFA0345A69615419897683FE4.description:

32ECD6980A2F42E7B050AF29783F6494.description:

5DED822953F647B7974466FD5E1AEF51.description: Label the parts of a dictionary definition.

1F931DB6EC5843C3BED45297A7A6022B.description: Use a dictionary to find the definition of a word.

44A42EFBD7684DBCA219A963DCDCEEED.description:
Determine
the meaning of a
word.

8E1A1F9C50E54025B44705A45D30E3D5.description:

or paragraph-level
context to determine
the meaning of
unfamiliar or multiplemeaning words or

BF8D62F0D3DF44B3BEAB36CB8DFFDAE7.description:
Use
context clues,
word structure, or
reference materials
to determine
the meaning of
unfamiliar words or
phrases.

239D9ED32C294494B524677756D3A87A.description:
Determine or clarify
the meaning of unknown and
multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on grade 7
reading and content, choosing
flexibly from a range of
strategies.
a. Use context (e.g., the overall
meaning of a sentence or
paragraph; a word’s position
or function in a sentence) as a
clue to the meaning of a word
or phrase.
b.Use common, gradeappropriate Greek or Latin
affixes and roots as clues to
the meaning of a word (e.g.,
belligerent, bellicose, rebel).
c. Consult general and
specialized reference materials
(e.g., dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print and
digital, to find the pronunciation
of a word or determine or
clarify its precise meaning or its
part of speech.
d.Verify the preliminary
determination of the meaning
of a word or phrase (e.g., by
checking the inferred meaning
in context or in a dictionary).

B9606CC6542C4D0082DEDC1BEBB91FA6.description:
Actively engage (through any mode of communication) in

language to

or feelings with
others.

information.

and concisely.

6F6BE908BEB947BB91E4D7A64F0508E9.description: Demonstrate an understanding of basic spelling rules.

letters for familiar

English capitalization,

a.Use a comma to separate

“He wore an old [,] green

AD3ADCF50C414A94B5BD538E0E0DF6DA.description:

c. Pose questions that elicit
elaboration and respond
to others’ questions and
comments with relevant
observations and ideas that

topic as needed.
d. Acknowledge new information
expressed by others and, when
warranted, modify their own
views.

5D218EBCC9F9438285D326E019D68B0D.description: Engage by actively listening to shared writing.

08BD09B3F2254EB59DB21E71116BBE8D.description:
Participate in
routine and varied
writing activities.

47721AC1B6674C19844772E1C06B4F9C.description:

“Compare and contrast a

place, or character and a
historical account of the
same period as a means of
understanding how authors
of fiction use or alter
history”).
b. Apply grade 7 reading
standards to literary
nonfiction (e.g., “Trace and
evaluate the argument and
specific claims in a text,
